title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality told through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling prophecy about the future and a timeless warning against totalitarianism.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic comedy about the manners and matrimonial machinations among the British gentry.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story of the young and mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with Daisy Buchanan.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A whaling voyage that explores themes of obsession, revenge, and humanity.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A coming-of-age novel that delves into teenage rebellion and identity.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A hobbit’s adventure to reclaim treasure guarded by a dragon.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: A tale of love, loss, and redemption following the life of Jane Eyre.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: An allegorical novel about a shepherd's journey to find a hidden treasure.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A novel that imagines a future society dominated by technology and conformity.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A harrowing tale of a father and son navigating a desolate, dangerous world.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: An allegorical novella reflecting the Russian Revolution and the rise of totalitarianism.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A story about a future society where books are outlawed and burned.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A tale of friendship and betrayal set against the backdrop of Afghanistan.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A sweeping saga of love, war, and family during the Napoleonic era.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: A young girl’s story of love and survival during World War II.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An epic poem about Odysseus' journey home from the Trojan War.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A story about vanity and moral corruption.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological exploration of guilt and redemption.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A story of passion and revenge on the Yorkshire moors.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five
author: Kurt Vonnegut
description: A satirical novel about war and human folly.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A deep exploration of faith, doubt, and morality.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: A tale of madness and supernatural horror set in a remote hotel.

title: It
author: Stephen King
description: A group of friends confront a monstrous evil that terrorized them as children.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: The tale of Count Dracula’s attempt to move from Transylvania to England.
